title: Angular momentum - L  of an object in a straight l

content.description: An object of mass <math alttext="2 kilograms" overflow="scroll"><mn>2</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg</mtext></math> is moving to the left with a constant speed of <math alttext="3 meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>3</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>m/s</mtext></math> along the dashed line <math alttext="y equals 3 meters" overflow="scroll"><mi>y</mi><mo>=</mo><mtext>3 m</mtext></math>. At the instant shown in the figure, the object is at coordinates <math alttext="open parenthesis, 4 meters, comma, 3 meters, closed parenthesis" overflow="scroll"> <mpadded> <mo>(</mo> <mpadded> <mtext>4 m</mtext> </mpadded> <mo>,</mo> <mpadded> <mtext>3 m</mtext> </mpadded> <mo>)</mo> </mpadded> </math>.
content.question: Which of the following is most nearly the magnitude of the angular momentum of the object with respect to the origin?

choices.label: <math alttext="18 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg路m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="24 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>24</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg路m/s</mtext></math>
<math alttext="30 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>30</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg路m/s</mtext></math>

content.answer: <math alttext="18 kilogram meters per second" overflow="scroll"><mn>18</mn><mspace width="0.2em"></mspace><mtext>kg路m/s</mtext></math>

unit.text: 6: Energy and Momentum of Rotating Systems

skill.text: 2.B: Calculate or estimate an unknown quantity with units from known quantities, by selecting and following a logical computational pathway.
